src.ui package¶

Submodules¶

src.ui.dashboard module¶

Just run using python dashboard.py

src.ui.dashboard.add_frame(text)[source]¶

Add frame to raw text.

Parameters:text – raw report text
Returns:report text with frame
src.ui.dashboard.assign_slider_text_update_callback(field: str) → None[source]¶

Register a callback on the text above categorical sliders. It will then update that text according to the current selection.

Parameters:field – the categorical data field
src.ui.dashboard.convert_category_number_to_str(d: dict)[source]¶

Given a dictionary of the form {field: value} convert values to their string representations if the field is categorical

Parameters:d – {field: value}
Returns:dictionary of the same form as the input
src.ui.dashboard.fig_formatter(**kw)[source]¶
src.ui.dashboard.generate_model_input(x_range: numpy.ndarray, exog: List[str], x_values: Tuple[float], x_var: str, n_points: int) → Dict[str, Union[numpy.ndarray, List[T]]][source]¶

Produce a dictionary to be passed to the model for prediction :param x_range: The values of x_var :param exog: The field to predict :param x_values: The slider values :param x_var: The continuous exogenous variable :param n_points: The number of points of the exogenous variable to use :return: {field: [v1, …, vn]}

src.ui.dashboard.make_hist_plot(fields, bar_width)[source]¶

Histogram plot callback

Parameters:
  • fields – content of dropdown menu
  • bar_width – value of slider
Returns:

plotly figure
src.ui.dashboard.make_importance_bar_plot(x: List[str], y: str)[source]¶

Create the importance bar plot

Parameters:
  • x – x variables list
  • y – y variable, normally self-efficiency
Returns:

plotly figure
src.ui.dashboard.make_prediction_plot(exog: List[T], endog: str, x_var: str, *slider_values)[source]¶

Callback to generate the prediction plot

Parameters:
  • exog – exogenous (independent) variable names as a list
  • endog – endogenous (dependent) variable name
  • x_var – another exogenous variable to be used as the plot’s x-axis
  • slider_values – tuple of the values of the sliders, including the hidden ones
Returns:

plotly figure
src.ui.dashboard.make_report(exog: List[T], endog: str, x_var: str, *slider_values)[source]¶

Generate report text.

Parameters:
  • exog – List of fields
  • endog – y variable
  • x_var – variable of x-axis
  • slider_values – values of all sliders in exog fields
Returns:

report text
src.ui.dashboard.make_second_explore_plot(categorical: list, continuous, plot)[source]¶

Make a plot based on the categorical and continuous data selected. Choose a box plot or frequency plot depending on the plot selected.

Parameters:
  • categorical – list of data categories
  • continuous – single continuous data field
  • plot – “frequency plot” or “box plot”
Returns:

plotly figure
src.ui.dashboard.make_sunburst(fields, color_var)[source]¶

Callback to generate the sunburst figure based on the selected categorical input fields and the desired continuous variable, used to color the segments.

Parameters:
  • color_var – The continuous variable with which to color the segments
  • fields – Categorical data fields with which to size segments by frequency
Returns:

plotly figure
src.ui.dashboard.populate_dropdown(category: str = None) → List[dict][source]¶

Generate a list of dictionaries to use to populate the dropdown menus

Parameters:category – ‘continuous’ or ‘categorical’. If None select all variables.
Returns:a list of dicts with keys ‘label’ and ‘value’
src.ui.dashboard.show_ml_sliders(fields: List[T], state: List[T])[source]¶

Show the sliders that were selected using the multiple dropdown. Hide the others. :param fields: List of fields :param state: children of the ml_sliders <P> :return: updated state

src.ui.dashboard.toggle_modal(n1, n2, is_open)[source]¶
src.ui.dashboard.train_model(endog: str, exog: List[str], x_var: str)[source]¶

Train predictive model based on the chosen variables

Parameters:
  • endog – endogenous (dependent) variable name
  • exog – exogenous (independent) variable names as a list
  • x_var – another exogenous variable that will be used as the x-axis in the plot
Returns:
